data.name: Guided Meditation VR
data.description:
Meditation made simple & visual.

Bring peace, joy, and calm back into your daily life with Guided Meditation VR™. Now in 5k on the Oculus Go.

– ENVIRONMENTS –
100+ lush environments to escape the every day.

– MINDFULNESS –
20+ hours of guided meditations in Zen, Loving Compassion, Maternity, Depression, or Sleep.

– CALMING MUSIC –
50+ relaxing audio tracks designed to enhance your meditation experience.

– CUSTOMIZE –
Prefer meditating on your own? Like music? No music? Customize your meditation sessions to be perfect, just for you. 

– TIMER –
Are you an advanced meditator? Use our simple meditation timer.

– PORTABLE –
Use at home, work, with the family, at the hospital, while your mind vacations in exotic locations across the universe.

– 100% FREE –
No in app purchases. No ads. No worries.

– CONTACT –
Ideas? We're here to help! Email gmvr@cubicleninjas.com.

Leave the worries of your life behind to return calmer and stronger. Find your happy place™.

changelog.change_log:
Hello World!

How are you? Hoping life is good since our last update. :D

Today's release brings some very visible, and many not so visible enhancements.

– 10 new 5k stereo environments! Explore beautiful new meditation spaces in Mt Huntington, Silver Alps, Japan, and Ripple Island.

– 20-minute, 30-minute, and 50-minute meditation sessions for Relaxation and Zen Categories.

– Download screen updates. Now we only show the latest environments so your downloading waiting is less frustrating.

– Bug fixes and enhancements.

– Languages –
We're working hard on German and Spanish versions of our meditation content. Unfortunately we had to re-record one series after it didn't meet our quality standards. We're hopeful to see these go live in the next update.

– Future Plans –
We have over 50 new 5k stereo environments that will be launching in the coming weeks, all 100% free. From underwater, to the shores of numerous virtual tropical beaches, and beyond.

– Guided Tai Chi –
Have an Oculus Quest? Our team recently released a new app called Guided Tai Chi, crafted from the ground up for wireless VR. It combines the meditative nature of our past work, with the joy of movement. We think you might enjoy it!

Thanks and happy meditating!
- Guided Meditation VR Team

Hello World!

Today's update brings a big bug fix and over 3 hours of new global meditation content. Updates include:

– We've fixed a random crash bug! Thank you to everyone who helped us track this down. 

– Japanese Language: We've launched a new 10-part meditation series for Focus.

– French Language: We've launched a new 10-part meditation series for Relaxation.

We also have over 40 new 5k stereo environments that will be launching in the coming weeks, all 100% free. From underwater, to the shores of numerous virtual tropical beaches, and beyond.

Thanks and happy meditating!
- Guided Meditation VR Team

Hello Guided Meditators!

It's an icy cold -15 degrees Fahrenheit here in Chicago. Five years ago this week, during an eerily similar snowstorm, we decided to make a virtual reality beach to escape. That funny side project was the start of the app you're exploring today. You never know what a random day might bring!

This evening's update (v 3.1.37) to Guided Meditation VR is the first launch in our 2019 roadmap.

– Global Language Support –

Today, we're excited to launch audio meditations in three new languages: Chinese, French, and Japanese. We hope you enjoy over 8 hours of new meditation content in the Zen, Focus, and Depression series. In the coming weeks we'll continue expand these libraries, while adding in Spanish and German audio meditations as well as completely new meditation series content.

To use these languages please select Custom Meditation > Guided Audio Meditation and choose a language from the top menu. 

And an additional reminder, all menus are translated as well. These can be modified in Options > Menu Language.

– Features and Refinements –

This version brings many often requested ideas. These include:

* Reclining Mode. If you're laying down or reclining we now prompt if you'd like to recenter your view. If you select 'Yes' we set your new forward and angle. If 'No' we don't bug you until your next meditation.

* Server Speed. This week we began rolling out server refinements. Our plan is to reduce download times by 2-3x by the end of February through a mixture of software and server enhancements.

* Featured Environment Priority. We now prioritize meditation mixes we've highlighted in the past in Quick Meditation. This ensures that new users get curated, high-quality experiences. Once these featured arrangements are used, we then we return to truly random scenarios.

* Platform Refinements. We spent the past few weeks refining our platform. All Guided apps now use the same scalable core which will be our foundation for instant features across current and future titles.

* Swipe to rotate. Reminder, you can swipe on the Oculus Go controller to rotate 45 degrees in the preferred direction. This lets you enjoy a fresh view very quickly.

* UI improvements. You can now start a featured meditation by clicking the box. No one requested this, but it saved us several seconds of life.

– New Environments –

Next week we'll have a massive environment update, launching more 5k environments than is healthy. These are our best work yet and we hope you enjoy them.

– Hidden Secret –

If you read this far, you're special. So special we'll let you in a on secret: our sister app Guided Relaxation VR goes 100% free on Monday, January 28th, 2019.

This app uses original stereo 5k video of the world's most relaxing spaces, from Hawaii to Iceland. You can also seamlessly enjoy Podcasts or Audiobooks in VR.

If you purchased this and feel frustrated by this change to free, please email grvr@cubicleninjas.com with your Oculus receipt email and we'll refund 100% of your money.

– How Can We Help? –

Ready to enjoy the weekend? If we can help with any bugs or ideas to make the app a better part of your day, send us an email at gmvr@cubicleninjas.com. 

Thanks!
- Guided Meditation VR team

Hello Guided Meditators!

It's Labor Day Weekend. We've been laboring hard on our end to launch some exciting enhancements in this late Friday update. 

– New Environments –

On the menu this weekend includes:

* Hana Valley (Spot 8) allows you to rest in a fresh bamboo forest, overlooking a beautiful lake. Off in the distance is a massive waterfall and an ancient city around the bend.

* Ripple Island beach has returned from two week's ago, now in full 5k glory and with further enhancements.

* Clouds! Float above the clouds as sun rises to day. Long requested. Finally delivered.

* Mt Huntington’s overlooks a massive forest lake as the sun rises and sets. We kept this in rotation by popular demand.

– Features and Refinements –

We made several dozen other important improvements! These include:

* Improved Carmack VR Player. We've made enhancements to the player which allow us to select a region of greater visual fidelity based on the stereo needs of that environment. You can see this in Ripple Island Sunset by looking down. :)

* Environment sorter update. You can now sort environments by 5k Stereo, Random, All, or previously downloaded.

* Swipe to rotate. You can now swipe on the Oculus Go controller to rotate 45 degrees in the preferred direction. This let's you enjoy a fresh view very quickly.

* Updating the Relaxation Series to show all ten meditation, which was not displaying properly due to a bug.

* Improved offline support. We'll only recommend timer if no content has been previously downloaded. If you have downloaded meditations only these will be displayed.

* Loader improvements. Slowed down the 360 photos when downloading content so it is less disorienting. We also are testing a background downloader in this build, for potential uses in the future.

* Environment improvements. We made a floating panda sit and clouds less derpy.

* UI improvements. You can now start a featured meditation by clicking the box. No one requested this, but it saved us several seconds of life.

– How Can We Help? –

Ready to enjoy the weekend? If we can help with any bugs or ideas to make the app a better part of your day, send us an email at gmvr@cubicleninjas.com.

Hello meditators!

After months of hard work, we’re excited to debut our biggest surprise yet... 

– 5k Stereo Environments –

You can now enjoy 5k stereo environments in Guided Meditation VR! 

We’re debuting this amazing technology today across our four, 100% new, featured environments. Powered at the core John Carmack’s recently released 5k video player, we’ve ported this over to the Unity game engine with a bunch of powerful enhancements, custom-built for our needs.

We’ll be sharing more information about these enhancements soon, but you should see glimpses of them in all of the featured spaces. Our plan will be to release 5k editions of our past environments from here on (which finally explains why we've been holding on re-releasing a few older ones). But in the meantime, we hope you love the massive leap in visual fidelity as much as we do!

* Please note, 5k is only currently available for Oculus Go users. Gear VR users will still enjoy the new environments, just not in 5k.

– Fresh Environments –

Today also marks the debut of four new meditation spots! These were custom built to make you smile.

* New Leaf is your very own private, magical redwood forest hideaway.
* Ripple Island’s lush foliage helps you refresh in the crisp jungle shade, just steps away from a toasty beach.
* Hana Valley’s new spot places you under a cherry blossom tree on a small island in Japan, which overlooks a massive waterfall.
* Mt Huntington’s new meditation space overlooks a massive forest lake as the sun rises and sets.

– How Is Your Day? –

Are you feeling solid today? Ready to take the world on? If we can help with any bugs or ideas to make the app a better part of your life, send us an email at gmvr@cubicleninjas.com. You are appreciated!

We’ll be sharing more information about these enhancements in the coming weeks, as well as beginning to release 5k editions of our past environments. But in the meantime, we hope you love the massive leap in visual fidelity as much as we do!

* Please note, this feature is only currently available for Oculus Go users.

– Fresh Environments –

Today also marks the debut of four new meditation spots!

* New Leaf is your very own private, magical redwood forest hideaway.
* Ripple Island’s lush foliage helps us to refresh in the crisp jungle shade, just steps away from the warm beaches.
* Hana Valley’s new spot places us under a cherry blossom tree on a small island in Japan, which overlooks a massive waterfall.
* Mt Huntington’s new spot overlooks a massive forest lake as the sun rises and sets.

Are you feeling good today? Ready to take the world on? If we can help with any bugs or ideas to make the app a better part of your life, send us an email at gmvr@cubicleninjas.com.

Update 8/9:
Improvements to Mt Huntington, Hana Valley, and Ripple Island. Performance tweaks for the Gear VR to reduce heat. Mt Huntington now has a night cycle.

Update 8/3:
Hello Guided Meditators!

– Announcing Menu Languages –

You can now enjoy Guided Meditation VR menus in Arabic, Chinese, French, German, Japanese, and Spanish.

Right now this only applies to the menu UI, but with time our aim is to release at least one meditation series per language. Kicking this off, later this month we'll launch 4 hours of Chinese meditation content.

We also have an updated options menu design to house both this and some future enhancements we're working on.

– New Environments –

We're debuting three new spots, across two environments this week!

Ripple Island Sunset is a luxurious private beach all to yourself. This is more than just a sunset, and if you stick around for the full thing you'll watch a slow transition to night. In the future our aim is to launch day, sunset, or night options for most content.

Hana Valley has received two new spots. One is featured, as you rest under a Sakura tree overlooking a massive waterfall.

– Disappearing Environments?! –

We've received a few notes wondering where some of the environments went. These include the loft apartment, the spa, and above Earth.

To be honest, we wanted to update these to look better. So, we're enhancing them to use our shiniest tech so when they return they are worth your full time.

– How Are You? –

Everything good? If we can help with any bugs or ideas, send us an email at gmvr@cubicleninjas.com. A real human will likely even respond!

Thanks!

Hello friends!

Today we're debuting two new environments as Featured Meditations. Enjoy them? Please let us know with a quick review!

*Ripple Island*
Bask in the Summer sun as cool tropical breezes dance around you.

*Mt Huntington*
Send your worries on vacation with this impossibly pretty mountain trail overlooking a vast lake.

You may notice that these spaces are extra special. That's because they're part of a new visual upgrade we've been hard at work on. Each week for the next few months we'll be debuting a new environment, which pushes the relaxation to the max.

Oh, and if you like music, we've also doubled the music options. There's a little something in there for everyone.

Have an idea for environment? Wish there was a feature? Just need someone to talk too? Email gmvr@cubicleninjas.com to speak with a human.

Happy meditating!

Too hot to go outside? We have you covered! Check out our refreshing Relaxation series, which just dropped last week.

This week's updates include improvements to the featured spaces, audio refinements, and the inclusion of delete button, allowing you to clear out space on your precious VR device. To delete your previously downloaded content, visit the options menu from the main menu.

On Monday we'll be launching a new 100% free content wave for Guided Meditation VR on the Rift, Vive, and Windows MR devices. Featuring 5 new environments, a music visualizer, radio mode, and an introduction, this has a little something for everyone. For those that have multiple VR headsets, these will eventually be making their way to the Gear VR and Go.

Happy meditating!

Time to relax? We agree!

This week we rebooted our Relaxation Meditation series. This new 10-part series uses Yoga Nidra to bring you to new levels of chill.

Other changes in today's update include new Oculus Go enhancements. If you're basking in any of the featured environments you might notice they look prettier. You are observant.

And we hate to tease, but next month will kick off the first wave of new environments since our Go relaunch. We think this is our best work yet and can't wait for you to take a peek. From the mountain forests, to rainy thunderstorms, and even the magic of space, we have something for everyone.

Any pressing ideas, questions, or concerns? Send us an email at gm@cubicleninjas.com. Happy meditating!

Today's hotfix improves performance on the S6 and S6 Edge, with optimizations to prevent the dreaded black screen of death while improving performance.

Happy early Father's Day to all of the cool dad's in virtual reality! This week's updates include shiny refinements to achievements, audio fades, UI optimizations, and preparation for a new meditation series debut next week. Have ideas on how to make the app even better or found a bug that needs squashing? Email us at gm@cubicleninjas.com. In the meantime, happy meditating!

Celebrate the weekend in style! Our fresh update improves the main menu, fixes tiny bugs, and launches a new feature meditation in the exotic waterfall escape of Nokia Bay. 

If you enjoy the app, please help spread the love by rating, reviewing, and sharing with your friends!
